document.docAuthor: Prins, Jurate De, Gumovsky, Alex & Coninck, Eliane De
document.masterDocTitle: Discovery of a new species of Caloptilia (Lepidoptera: Gracillariidae) from east and central Africa with its suggested associated host (Gentianales: Rubiaceae) and natural enemies (Hymenoptera: Eulophidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Discovery of a new species of Caloptilia (Lepidoptera: Gracillariidae) from east and central Africa with its suggested associated host (Gentianales: Rubiaceae) and natural enemies (Hymenoptera: Eulophidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Gumovsky
bibRefCitation.refString: Gumovsky, A. (2007) Taxonomic notes on genera allied to Pleurotroppopsis (Hymenoptera: Eulophidae, Entedoninae) with description of a new genus from the Afrotropical region. Zootaxa, 1415, 1 - 16.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Democratic Republic of Congo :
1 ♀, P.N.A.,
22 .x. 1952
, Ac. No.
1361 - 62
, Massif Ruwenzori, Kyandolire, 1700 m , Camp des Gardes, leg. P. Vanschuytbroeck & J. Kekenbosch, in RMCA .
Kenya :
3 ♂
, 8 ♀, Arabuko Sokoke, Mixed forest, 50 m ,
05.iv. 2001
, ex
Cremaspora trifolia
( Rubiaceae ),
21 .iv. 2001
, host
Caloptilia mwamba
sp. nov.
( Gracillariidae ),
03° 17 'S
39 ° 58 'E
(E 8 ), leg. J. & W. De Prins, in RMCA .
Zambia :
1 ♀, South Luangwa, ~ 20 km W Mfuwe, riverbank between the “Crock Valley” and “Thorneycroft” camps,
19 .xii. 2011
, leg. A. Gumovsky, in SIZK .

Description. Female ,
Figs. 27 –29
,
33– 38
. Full description see:
Gumovsky 2007
. Also: antennae with symmetrical and short ampulliform sensilla; semicircular carina below the shoulder at lateral panel of pronotum ends with a series of small orifices (
Fig. 37
). Fore wing WIP (Wing Interference Pattern) with a broad blue field along costal margin in Kenyan specimens and paratypes (from RSA ,
Fig. 55
); with narrower blue field in the holotype (larger female from Senegal ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 27–32.
Afrotroppopsis risbeci
habitus. 27, holotype (Senegal). 28–32, specimens collected in Kenya. 28, 29, females, 30–32, males. 30, larger specimen of males. 31, 32, smaller specimen of males. Scale bar as indicated.

FIGURES 33–38. Micro-morphology of the females of
Afrotroppopsis risbeci
collected in Kenya. 33, habitus, lateral view. 34, head, frontal view. 35, head and mesosoma. 36, lower face. 37, lateral panel of pronotum. 38, propodeum. Scale bar as indicated.

FIGURES 39–42. Micro-morphological variation of males of
Afrotroppopsis risbeci
.
39, scutellum and propodeum (smaller specimen). 40, head and pronotum, dorsal view (smaller specimen). 41, scutellum and propodeum, enlarged (smaller specimen). 42, scutellum and propodeum, enlarged (larger specimen). Scale bar as indicated.

FIGURES 43–48. Males of
Afrotroppopsis risbeci
(smaller specimen, two specimens, 1.9–2.2 mm). 43, 44, habitus, lateral view. 45, 46, 48, head and mesosoma, in different enlargements. 47, lateral panel of pronotum. Scale bar as indicated.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host.
Caloptilia mwamba
sp. nov.
( Gracillariidae ) ( new record ). Earlier it was recorded from unidentified leaf miners from Senegal mahogany,
Khaya senegalensis (Desv.) A. Juss.
[ Meliaceae ] in Senegal , and
Ochna pulchra Hook.
[ Ochnaceae ] in South Africa (
Gumovsky 2007 : 7
).
